page.title: 06GREAT SAMPFORD CofE CHURCH
page.content: Gt.Sampford Church is a Saxon church.The South Trancept(which was the first part of the church to be built)was constructed in about 1300. The second parts of the church to be built were the Nave and the North Aisle.They were built between 1320 and 1340.The Chancel was built by 1340 and the South Aisle,the Tower and the Porch were built by 1350.There are five bells in the tower.They are not used now.On a normal Sunday the congregation is about twenty and on parades the amount of people varies between twenty five and thirty.A new vicar was inducted at this church last month.He is the Rev.Dr.Mark Glasswell.Before his appointment he was at a University in Nigeria.On some Sundays a Sunday Club is run by Mrs Sorger.
